learning_outcomes.description: Explain, discuss and cricially examine the key theoretical and knowledge-based content areas of organisational psychology related to the practicum experience
Demonstrate practical skills related to those content areas of organisational psychology which formed the theoretical/knowledge basis of practicum experience
Understand and demonstrate ethical practice in respect to the profession of psychology and specifically, within an organisational psychology context

assessments.task_description:
The practicum folio is a compilation of work undertaken during the placement. The folio consists of an exemplar of client-related and evidence-based work associated with the practica which has been undertaken and thus will differ in form and content for each student. Details regarding preparation and requirement of folio reports are contained in the Practicum Manual and will be discussed during review meetings with your Senior Psychologist (Organisational).

Note that there are no maximum word limits for the practicum folio – indeed, some organisational reports are quite long and complex. In the interests of fairness however, written work such as essays and reports are required to have a minimum word count of 2000 words.

Students are required to submit a printed copy of the placement folio directly to the Senior Psychologist (Organisational).  Once feedback has been provided, and the student has completed and resubmitted any requested amendments, the student must upload the final folio version (complete with any amendments) as a scanned PDF file via Turnitin.  Please note that the final grade for the placement course will not be released to the student until the folio is successfully uploaded.
assessments.submission_guidelines: A hard copy of the folio and all other required documentation to be submitted directly to the Senior Psychologist (Organisational)

assessments.task_description: Students must engage in and document 35 practicum supervision hours via the practicum supervision logbook. The practicum supervision logbook should detail the learning, reflections and agreed objectives discussed in supervision and be signed by the student and their assigned placement supervisor a minimum of monthly. Separate logs should be maintained for each supervisor, where more than one has been approved for placement supervision.

assessments.task_description: A mid-point and final review of work performance including knowledge and skill development must be undertaken by the student and assigned supervisor approximately half-way through the placement (Mid-Point Review) and at the conclusion of the placement (Final Review). The student and supervisor must complete and sign the Mid-Point Review and Final Review documents prior to their submission to the Senior Psychologist (Organisational). The Mid-Point Review should be submitted to the Senior Psychologist promptly (within 7 days of its completion).
